attributes.action: seek approval from the UN general assembly to allow Amnesty International & UNESCO to “full urgent action” to be allowed to send observers to investigate the Robert Mugabe regime for violations against human rights, the 1975 UN declaration against torture, The International Covenant on Civil and Political rights and the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights or better know as the 1976 Bill of rights, including the 1987 Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I also call upon UN general assembly, Amnesty International & UNESCO to use the 60th ratification of the Rome Statue to ensure Robert Mugabe is punished according and under the International Criminal Court.

rejection.details: There are many similar petitions, see http://search.petitions.pm.gov.uk/kbroker/number10/petitions/search.lsim?qt=zimbabwe&sr=0&nh=10&cs=&sc=number10&oq=reduce+fuel+tax&sb=0&ha=1157&mt=0
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
